name: Cigfa

attributes.attribute: son of the goddess Rhiannon and her consort Pwyll

entities.type: son of the goddess Rhiannon and her consort Pwyll

sources: Gantz, Jeffrey, trans. *The Mabinogion*. (New York: Barnes & Noble Books, 1976), 90-95.
Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Welsh heroine or goddess, Cigfa (Kigva), was married to Pryderi, who was Rhiannon's son and Pwyll's consort. In the third branch of the Welsh Mabinogion, Cigfa's husband became trapped along with his mother in a Fairy Mound by magical means. After this, Cigfa remained faithful to Rhiannon’s second husband, Manawydan. She broke the enchantment on their spouses by living chastely with him until he discovered a solution.
